meanings.definition: A member of the Sturmabteilung, a paramilitary organization in Nazi Germany.
meanings.sent1: The brownshirt marched in line with his fellow members of the paramilitary group.
meanings.sent2: Many people were afraid of the brownshirts and their extreme beliefs.
meanings.sent3: The brownshirt accidentally spilled coffee on his uniform during a break.
meanings.sent4: She felt like a brownshirt, enforcing strict rules in her own household.
meanings.sent5: The image of the brownshirt standing tall in his uniform was unsettling.

meanings.definition: A supporter or member of a fascist or authoritarian group.
meanings.sent1: As a brownshirt, he strongly believed in the ideologies of the authoritarian group.
meanings.sent2: The brownshirts gathered to show their allegiance to the dictator.
meanings.sent3: The brownshirt proudly displayed the group's flag in his room.
meanings.sent4: She saw herself as a brownshirt, blindly following the leader's commands.
meanings.sent5: The brownshirt's loyalty to the group was unwavering.

meanings.sent1: She wore a comfortable brownshirt to the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The store had a sale on brownshirts, so he bought a few.
meanings.sent3: The brownshirt matched perfectly with his favorite pair of jeans.
meanings.sent4: Her brownshirt reminded her of the earthy tones of autumn leaves.
meanings.sent5: The soft fabric of the brownshirt felt cozy against her skin.
